result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Botelho

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:07 PM Defendant Michael J Botelho in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Michael J Botelho. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defense requests time to review discovery.
Defense to file a motion no later than September 12, 2022. 
Courts sets a plea and sentencing date anticipating setting a motion hearing prior to plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  **Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's calendar.**
Hearing on August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

01:23 PM Defendant Michael J Botelho in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

01:22 PM Defendant Michael J Botelho in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.
Attorney Miller requests an afternoon time slot as the Defendant has to drive 3 hours.
The Court so grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
EXT CODE 2

09:19 AM Attorney Cassandra A Miller in court.   Defendant Michael J Botelho did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Miller does not have any information to provide the Court as to the defendant's whereabouts.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:10 PM Defendant Michael J Botelho in court with State Public Defender Law Intern.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court provides the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel to fill out prior to the next Court date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
